page.title: 11Fauna- Nature Reserve (Wyre)
page.content: Proper management of the Wyre Forest promotes and provides cover for the plethora of animal life.The central position means that both Eastern and Western species of{bird}abound,such as Buzzard, Pied and Grey Wagtail, Chiff Chaff and Dipper. Unusual{mammals}are Polecat, Dormouse and Yellow-necked Mouse. Fallow Deer, introduced in 1920, are so numerous that culling is necessary. There are 32 kinds of {butterfly.}Help is given with the Annual National Butterfly Count. A trout stream running through woodland has{amphibians}- Newts, Frogs, Toads. {Fish}include Salmon, Roach and Chub - also Crayfish. Among{insects}Wood- boring beetles,White-barred Clear- wing, bugs and large ant hills make this an entomologist's playground. {Reptiles}include Slow Worms, Grass Snakes and fast-declining Adders.
